intro: Greenella arizonica, commonly known as Arizona greenbell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native ecosystem.
